comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This is not a Farman 40 AR... it is a Caudron G.III being used for training duties most probably with the Americans at the 1st AIC at Tours, France in late 1917 thru 1918. The Caudron was a pre-war design that was very successful at the Front for reconnaisance purposes and later in the training role. A twin engined G.IV was also produced that saw a lot of action with the French at the Front as well.

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives
